alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 10:32AM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Baltimore MD/Washington DC has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Maryland... Conococheague Creek at Fairview affecting Washington County. For the Conococheague Creek...including Fairview...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Conococheague Creek at Fairview. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Wishard Road and Kemp Mill Road are both flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 3.1 feet, or 6.9 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Mon Tue Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7PM 1AM 7AM Stg Time Date Conococheague Creek Fairview 10.0 3.1 Mon 9 am 3.0 3.0 2.9 10.0 7pm Wed &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/washington or weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this evening at 645 PM EST.
